funkatronics.code.tactilewaves.dsp.toolbox

Class Cepstrum

  • java.lang.Object
    • funkatronics.code.tactilewaves.dsp.toolbox.Cepstrum

  • public class Cepstrum
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for performing Cepstral Transforms on audio data

    See this website for a basic explanation of Cepstral Analysis.

    See Also:
    FFT, MFCC

      • estimatePitch

        public static float estimatePitch(float[] x,
                                  int Fs)
        Estimate the pitch of an audio signal using Cepstral analysis and return it
        Parameters:
        x - the signal to process
        Fs - the sample rate of the audio (needed to convert pitch to Hz
        Returns:
        the estimated pitch in Hz

      • estimateFormants

        public static float[] estimateFormants(float[] x,
                                       int FNum,
                                       int Fs)
        Estimate the formant frequencies of an audio signal using Cepstral analysis
        Parameters:
        x - the signal to process
        FNum - the number of Formants to estimate
        Fs - the sample rate of the audio - used to convert formants to Hz.
        Returns:
        an array of estimated formant frequencies

      • lifterLT

        public static void lifterLT(float[] X,
                            int Lc)
        Perform Low-Time Liftering on an audio signal

        "Liftering" in the quefrency domain is equivalent to filtering in the frequency domain. "Low-Time Liftering" is similar to low-pass filtering in that slowly varying components of the signal are kept while quickly varying content is attenuated

        Parameters:
        X - the Cepstrum to lifter
        Lc - the cuttoff length of the liftering window

      • lifterHT

        public static void lifterHT(float[] X,
                            int Lc)
        Perform High-Time Liftering on an audio signal

        "Liftering" in the quefrency domain is equivalent to filtering in the frequency domain. "High-Time Liftering" is similar to high-pass filtering in that quickly varying components of the signal are kept while slowly varying content is attenuated

        Parameters:
        X - the Cepstrum to lifter
        Lc - the cuttoff length of the liftering window
